Can the app detect other readings?

AirApp is an Android application for indoor air quality monitoring . The app uses real-time readings of eCO2 and TVOC readings from CCS811 Air Quality sensor - which is connected to a NodeMCU, placed inside a waste bin. This application is used to control air pollution of household waste.

eCO2 stands for Equivalent calculated Carbon Dioxide, measured using parts-per-million (ppm). The sensor is able to pick up readings up to 8192 ppm. 350 - 1000 ppm; typical concentration within indoor space with good air exchange. 1000 - 2000 ppm; eCO2 levels are relatively high. Expect drowsiness and poor air. 2000 - 5000 ppm; eCO2 are severely high. Expect headaches, sleepines and stagnant, stale, stuffy air.

TVOC stands for Total Volative Organic Compound, measured using parts-per-billion (ppb). The sensor is able to pick up readings up to 1187 ppb. TVOC are emitted by majority of household products such as: paints, aerosol sprays, air fresheners, craft materials including glues, adhesives and permanent markets. 50 - 325 ppb; are thought to be acceptable. Any readings higher than 325 ppb are usually harmful.
Currently, the NodeMCU is not equipped with other sensors such as Humidity sensor. However, in future work - hardware and software upgrade will be implemented.
